reqs:
Pre-reqs: BIOL 200 and one of CHEM 233, CHEM 260. (; or BIOL 200 and a corequisite of CHEM 213; or a corequisite of either CHEM 313 or CHEM 330.)
BIOL 201 uses a staggered seat release such that about 50 seats per section per day will be released during the week of 2nd year registration. Please register for BOTH LECTURE AND TUTORIAL SECTIONS. DO NOT contact the course instructors regarding registration issues. If your desired section is full, please register for the next best available lecture and tutorial section to be sure of your space in the course. For other issues please send an e-mail to: biol201@biology.ubc.ca
If you are a transfer student, please ensure your transfer credits have been articulated and entered into the system, then contact the course coordinator for registration assistance.
Choose one section from all 2 activity types (e.g. Lecture and Tutorial).

This is the wait-list for BIOL 201-201. Please do not contact course instructors about registration issues, as course registrations/ wait-lists are managed by the course registration coordinator. Students are moved in chronological order from the wait-list into the course as space becomes available. Timetables may be modified to allow for conflict-free registration. It is the students responsibility to check SSC for registration changes. Information on wait-list positioning will not be provided.

description: Biological molecules, protein structure and enzyme action, energy transfer, central metabolic pathways and their regulation. Examples drawn from plants, animals and microorganisms. (Consult the Credit Exclusion list within the Faculty of Science section of the Calendar.)
